page.title: 09SHOPS IN SOUTHBOROUGH 1985
page.content: Many of the shops in Southborough are situated along London Road. Although Southborough is quite small in size, there is a great variety of shops, mainly selling specialized goods. 'Liptons' and 'Co-op' are two of the five small supermarkets. There is only one bakery and this is very small. The 'Southborough Delicatessen' is a new shop and is a favourite with many people. A similar shop is the 'Southborough Pie Shop'. There is a wide selection of cafes and take-aways varying from a tea shop to one serving oriental food. Most essential services are catered for, from launderettes to banks and Building Societies. Southborough has two chemists. There are a few clothes shops which are expensive when compared to shops in Tunbridge Wells, but the shopping area is easy to reach.
